results.title: Dust
results.creator_credit: Milcho Manchevski, Domenico Procacci, Vesna Jovanoska, Chris Auty, Shadow Films, Fandango, Ena Films, A history Dreams and Film Consortium
results.brief_description: Modern day Manhattan and an intruder, Edge, rifles through the apartment of an elderly lady, Angela who gets the better of him and bails him up with her rifle. At gunpoint Edge is forced to listen to a story from Angela’s past - two American rival brothers Luke (the elder and a fiery sharp shooter) and Elijah (a Bible quoting preacher) who lived at the turn of the 19th century. When Elijah marries the prostitute that Luke has designs on, the latter flees to Macedonia and joins the local resistance fighters who are trying to rid their country of occupying Turkish forces. Elijah pursues his brother across the world and signs up with the opposing forces, the Turkish leaders, in order to extract revenge. In “Dust”, present and past stories run parallel, occasionally melding, enabling Manchevski to remark upon the elusive nature of history. At times graphically bloody with a very high body count, the elliptical structure of “Dust” may frustrate some viewers but the cinematography and Macedonian setting are beautiful to watch. “Dust” is the second film from Macedonian director, Milcho Manchevski (Before the rain). Cast includes Joseph Fiennes, David Wenham, Adrian Lester, Anne Brochet.

results.creator_credit: Jean-Michel Labrosse, Pierre Moretti, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animation film about a clarinet and a trumpet that meet, clash, compete, compromise and harmonise. Sound film without words.

results.title: Ducks, of course
results.creator_credit: William H. Carrick, John Howe, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: That one duck is not necessarily the same as another is made clear in this film, which has as its objective the protection of the dwindling species. The star of the film is a hunter who is obviously light on duck lore but heavy on the trigger. By the time everything has been made clear, he (and the viewer) knows a good deal more about duck identification.

results.title: Duck soup
results.brief_description: The funniest Marx Brothers film is thankfully free of tacked-on studio romance, free of sentimentality and it is joyously anarchic. Groucho is head of the struggling country of Freedonia. Battling power-hungry courtiers and devious politicians, the four brothers have to defend their tiny country from the threat of war. “Duck Soup” includes some of the funniest dialogue and innovative visual comedy in the history of film including the classic “fake-mirror” scene, the lemonade-stand torture scene and the Civil War spoof. This film has inspired directors as diverse as Woody Allen and Stanley Kubrick. “Duck Soup” is hilarious, witty, and vulgar. War has never been so ridiculous, patriotism has never been so wondefully subverted.

results.title: Duck farming: an indonesian tradition
results.creator_credit: Peter Donaldson, Nick Anderson and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Duck farming has been an integral part of Indonesian society for centuries. A Research Institute in Java, set up by the Indonesian and Australian governments, aims to increase productivity by improved breeding and feeding techniques. The film explores the variety of techniques and traditions and, in the process, gives a unique perspective to the complexities of Indonesian society.

results.title: Duck
results.brief_description: Four lucky ducks escape death from hunters when a lonely man takes them into his home and his life. A claymation tale set to original music written by Ollie Brown. Animation by Jesse van den Dungen.

results.title: Duel in the sun
results.creator_credit: King Vidor, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: Scott Chavez, hung for the murder of his wife and her lover, sends his daughter to live with land baron Senator McCanles. The senator’s sons are immediately drawn to Pearl and fall under her spell. Brother is pitted against brother in this classic western filled with love, betrayal and murder. Starring Gregory Peck and Jennifer Jones as the ill-fated lovers and an admirable cast including Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Herbert Marshall, Lillian Gish, Walter Huston and Charles Bickford.

results.title: Dublin
results.brief_description: A practical guide for anyone intending to travel to Ireland’s capital city. Highlights the major cultural attractions and districts. Provides advice on public transport and accommodation. Indicates the best times to visit the main cultural institutions. Suggests places to eat and what you should expect to pay. Includes information on Trinity College, Grafton Street, Waterford Crystal, Powerscourt Gardens, Aran sweaters, literary pub crawls and fishing trips. Presented by John Guerrasio.

results.title: Dryland salinity
results.creator_credit: Bill Cherry, Evelyn Cherry, Cherry Film Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Soil salinity is a problem that seriously affects many farmers in the Great Plains region of the Canadian West. More than two million hectares of cultivated land are already altered by high salt content, and more rich soil is lost each year. As the film explains, agricultural scientists now question certain traditional farm practices, and farmers and researchers are experimenting together to find new grass crops more tolerant of soil salinity. The problem is recognized as a community concern, and solutions do now exist.
